free_text.Learning outcomes: Introduction to the physical mechanisms governing stellar equilibrium, stellar evolution and nucleosynthesis.Study of evolution from star formation to supernovae and condensed remnants.
free_text.Content: Mechanical equilibrium[br/]Thermal equilibrium and radiative transfer[br/]Nuclear reactions[br/]Numerical simulations[br/]Star formation and observations[br/]Hydrogen burning phase[br/]Helium burning and advanced nuclear phases[br/]Supernovae and nucleosynthesis[br/]White dwarfs, neutron stars and black holes[br/]Stellar pulsations[br/]Helioseismology and asteroseismology[br/][br/]Lecturer : Prof. Georges Meynet, Observatoire de Genève

free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Introduction to the physical mechanisms governing stellar equilibrium, stellar evolution and nucleosynthesis.Study of evolution from star formation to supernovae and condensed remnants.
